Break it gently to my mother :
song and chorus : sung by Buckley's serenaders /
words by Mary A. Griffith ; music by Fredk. Buckley.
Tenth title in a volume with binder's title: E. Owens.
Table of contents for M1.A15 vol. 3 laid in container.

"This ballad was suggested by the following incident. On the battle-field of Gettysburg, among many of our wounded soldiers was a young man the only son of an aged mother. Hearing the surgeon tell his companions that he could not survive the ensuing night, he placed his hand upon his forehead, talking continually of his mother and sister, and said to his comrades assembled around him, "Break it gently to my mother."

LC volume 3 has slip inserted: "Music popular 1865 to 1870, owned by Miss Eliza Owens of New York State, who married Josiah Evans Owens II. Presented to the Library of Congress by their daughter Mabel Ruth Owens, Mrs. E.V. Wilcox."
